title.rendered: Explore Job Roles: Marine Engineers and Naval Architects

content.rendered:
What are Marine Engineers and Naval Architects?

Marine Engineers and Naval Architects are the designers, builders, and engineers of oceanic vehicles like ships and submarines.

Where do Marine Engineers and Naval Architects work?

  • Engineering companies
  • Government 
  • Transportation services

How much do Marine Engineers and Naval Architects make?

Based on real new grad salaries reported through Handshake, the median annual salary for Marine Engineers and Naval Architects is $63,000.

What majors are typically interested in becoming Marine Engineers and Naval Architects?

One’s major doesn’t necessarily determine their career, but these are some common majors of those who end up pursuing this career path.

  • Naval architecture majors
  • Marine engineering majors
  • Mechanical engineering majors
  • Electrical engineering majors
Search Marine Engineer and Naval Architect jobs

Marine Engineers and Naval Architects skills and competencies:

On top of a relevant degree and formal training, here are some professional skills that can help aspiring Marine Engineers and Naval Architects succeed in their work:

  • Strong communication skills
  • Good understanding of mathematics
  • Ability to think on your feet

What are some common questions about Marine Engineers and Naval Architects?

Q: What’s the difference between Marine Engineers and Naval Architects?

A: Both work collaboratively! Marine Engineers are tasked with working on the ships and their structures and Naval Architects spearhead the design of the vessels.
